cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 3.11 jenkins-2-plugins security update

full_product_name.product_name: jenkins-0:2.204.2.1585048146-1.el7 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11
jenkins-2-plugins-0:3.11.1585050035-1.el7 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11

notes.note: openshift/jenkins-plugin: Deserialization in snakeyaml YAML() objects allows for remote code execution

reference.description: bz#1816433: CVE-2020-2167 openshift/jenkins-plugin: Deserialization in snakeyaml YAML() objects allows for remote code execution

remediation.description:
See the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for release
3.11.188, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully
apply this asynchronous errata update:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/release_notes/ocp_3_11_release_notes.html
This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the
Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258.

note:
An update for jenkins-2-plugins is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

Jenkins is a continuous integration server that monitors executions of repeated jobs, such as building a software project or jobs run by cron.
Security Fix(es):
* openshift/jenkins-plugin: Deserialization in snakeyaml YAML() objects allowed for remote code execution (CVE-2020-2167)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
